cultural_etiquette: Bow slightly when greeting; the deeper the bow, the more respect shown.
Never tip at restaurants; exceptional service is included in the price.
Keep your voice low on public transport and in temples.
important_tips: Download the 'Tablelog' app for restaurant reviews.
Carry a small bag for your trash, as public bins are rare.
Suica/Pasmo cards can be added to Apple/Google Wallet for easy taxi payments.

accommodation.booking_tip: Request a 'Classy King' room for floor-to-ceiling city views.
accommodation.name: The Gate Hotel Asakusa Kaminarimon
accommodation.why_this: Offers an exclusive rooftop terrace with the best views of the Tokyo Skytree.

activities.description: Tokyo's oldest temple, dedicated to Kannon. Walk through the Kaminarimon Gate and soak in the incense-filled air of the main hall.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Senso-ji, Asakusa, Taito City, Tokyo, Japan
activities.local_secret: Walk to the adjacent Asakusa Jinja; it is much quieter and offers stunning photo ops of the pagoda.
activities.why_this_fits: Perfect introduction to Japanese Buddhist culture and architecture.

activities.description: A legendary establishment serving world-class Wagyu Sukiyaki since 1895 in a refined, traditional setting.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Asakusa Imahan, Taito City, Tokyo, Japan
activities.local_secret: Request a private tatami room for an authentic heritage feel.
activities.tips: Book at least 3 weeks in advance.
activities.why_this_fits: A high-end culinary experience focusing on premium Japanese beef.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Explore the ancient Senso-ji Temple and Nakamise-dori.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Mild (15°C). A light trench coat is perfect for evening breezes.
itinerary.evening_summary: Luxury Sukiyaki dinner with views of the Sumida River.
itinerary.morning_summary: Arrival at Narita and private transfer to Asakusa.
itinerary.notes: Focus on recovery from the flight today.

accommodation.booking_tip: Use the hotel's concierge to book hard-to-get restaurant slots.
accommodation.name: The Gate Hotel Asakusa Kaminarimon

activities.description: A massive Shinto shrine dedicated to Emperor Meiji, nestled in a 170-acre forest in the heart of the city.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Meiji Jingu, Shibuya City, Tokyo, Japan
activities.local_secret: Visit the Inner Garden (Gyoen) to see the sacred well of Kiyomasa.
activities.tips: Look for traditional Shinto wedding processions on the main path.
activities.why_this_fits: Deep dive into Shinto culture and imperial history.

activities.description: Contemporary Japanese fine dining on the 40th floor, famous from the movie 'Lost in Translation'.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Kozue, Park Hyatt Tokyo, Shinjuku, Japan
activities.local_secret: Arrive 30 mins early for a cocktail at the New York Bar next door.
activities.tips: The seasonal tasting menu is the best way to experience the chef's skill.
activities.why_this_fits: Luxury dining with an iconic Tokyo skyline backdrop.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Luxury shopping and architecture walk in Omotesando.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Sunny. Wear comfortable walking shoes for the shrine gravel.
itinerary.evening_summary: Fine dining at Kozue with views of Mount Fuji.
itinerary.morning_summary: Private guided tour of Meiji Jingu Shrine.
itinerary.notes: Omotesando is great for high-end Japanese labels like Comme des Garçons.

accommodation.booking_tip: Located right next to Kyoto Station for ultimate convenience.
accommodation.name: The Thousand Kyoto
accommodation.why_this: A 'comfort hotel' that feels like a modern sanctuary with incredible spa facilities.

activities.description: Travel at 300km/h in the luxury 'Green Car' (First Class) with spacious seating and footrests.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Tokyo Station, Chiyoda City, Tokyo, Japan
activities.how_to_reach: Private Taxi to Tokyo Station — ₹2000, 15 min
activities.local_secret: Sit on the right side (Seat E) for the best views of Mt. Fuji.
activities.tips: Buy a 'Premium Ekiben' (lunch box) at Tokyo Station before boarding.
activities.why_this_fits: The pinnacle of Japanese transport luxury.

activities.description: Explore the preserved wooden machiya houses and look for Geiko (Geisha) heading to evening appointments.
activities.local_secret: Walk along the Shirakawa Canal; it's less crowded than Hanami-koji.
activities.tips: Do not touch the Geisha or block their path for photos.
activities.why_this_fits: Immersive cultural experience in Japan's most famous heritage district.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Private walking tour of the Gion District.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Kyoto is slightly cooler; carry a light pashmina.
itinerary.evening_summary: Exclusive Kaiseki dinner in a converted tea house.
itinerary.morning_summary: Shinkansen Green Car journey to Kyoto.
itinerary.notes: Kyoto is best explored by a mix of walking and private taxis.
itinerary.theme: Bullet Train to the Ancient Capital

accommodation.booking_tip: The hotel bar has an excellent selection of Japanese whiskies.
accommodation.name: The Thousand Kyoto
accommodation.why_this: Centrally located for easy access to both northern and southern temples.

activities.description: A Zen temple whose top two floors are completely covered in gold leaf, reflecting in the Kyoko-chi pond.
activities.local_secret: Go exactly at opening time to see the gold glow in the morning light.
activities.tips: The path is one-way; take your best photos from the first viewpoint.
activities.why_this_fits: Iconic cultural landmark representing the Muromachi period.

activities.activity: Private Tea Ceremony at Camellia Garden
activities.description: An intimate, private introduction to the 'Way of Tea' in a traditional wooden house.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Camellia Garden Tea Ceremony, Kyoto, Japan
activities.local_secret: Ask the tea master about the significance of the seasonal scroll in the alcove.
activities.tips: Wear clean socks as you will be sitting on tatami mats.
activities.why_this_fits: Exclusive access to a highly refined cultural ritual.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Private Tea Ceremony in a hidden garden.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Expect morning mist. Great for temple photography.
itinerary.morning_summary: Visit Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion) and Ryoan-ji Zen Garden.
itinerary.notes: Ryoan-ji is just a 15-min walk from Kinkaku-ji.

accommodation.booking_tip: Book the 'Premier' room for extra space.
accommodation.name: The Thousand Kyoto
accommodation.why_this: Reliable luxury and great breakfast options.

activities.description: Walk through towering stalks of green bamboo that sway and whistle in the wind.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Arashiyama Bamboo Forest, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto, Japan
activities.local_secret: Enter through the north gate of Tenryu-ji to bypass the main tourist crowds.
activities.tips: Arrive before 9 AM for the best photos without crowds.

activities.description: A luxury tofu restaurant tucked away in the cliffs of Arashiyama with stunning river views.
activities.local_secret: The restaurant is hard to find; look for the small stone path near the river.
activities.tips: The 'Kyo-kaiseki' tofu set is their signature.
activities.why_this_fits: Exquisite vegetarian-friendly fine dining in a breathtaking location.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Private boat ride on the Hozugawa River.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Arashiyama can be breezy; a light scarf is recommended.
itinerary.morning_summary: Arashiyama Bamboo Grove and Tenryu-ji Temple.
itinerary.notes: Arashiyama is particularly beautiful during Sakura season.

accommodation.booking_tip: Ask for a late checkout to enjoy your final morning.
accommodation.name: The Gate Hotel Asakusa Kaminarimon
accommodation.why_this: Familiarity for the final night and easy airport access.

activities.description: Famous for its thousands of vermilion torii gates that straddle a network of trails behind the main buildings.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Fushimi Inari-taisha, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto, Japan
activities.local_secret: Most people stop at the first loop; hike up 20 mins further to the 'Yotsutsuji' intersection for city views.
activities.tips: Buy a small wooden torii gate to leave your wish at the shrine.
activities.why_this_fits: Essential cultural site dedicated to Inari, the god of rice.

activities.description: Michelin-starred Edomae-style sushi where every piece is a work of art served at a counter.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Sushi Ginza Onodera, Ginza, Tokyo, Japan
activities.local_secret: The lunch set is equally high quality but significantly more affordable.
activities.tips: Book exactly 1 month in advance when reservations open.
activities.why_this_fits: The ultimate luxury food experience in Japan.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Shinkansen back to Tokyo and Ginza exploration.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Warm (18°C). Perfect for hiking the shrine trails.
itinerary.evening_summary: Farewell Omakase Sushi dinner in Ginza.
itinerary.morning_summary: Early morning visit to Fushimi Inari Shrine.
itinerary.notes: Includes Shinkansen ticket cost (₹8,300) in day total.

activities.description: Tokyo's most stylish shopping complex featuring luxury brands and a stunning rooftop garden.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Ginza Six, Chuo City, Tokyo, Japan
activities.local_secret: Visit the Tsutaya Books on the 6th floor; it's one of the most beautiful bookstores in the world.
activities.tips: The basement food hall (Depachika) is perfect for buying high-end edible gifts.
activities.why_this_fits: High-end retail therapy and modern Japanese design.

itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Check flight status; spring winds can occasionally cause delays.
itinerary.morning_summary: Leisurely breakfast and last-minute shopping in Ginza.
itinerary.notes: Includes private airport transfer (₹4,500) in day total.

money_saving_hacks: Eat 'Depachika' (department store basement) meals for a high-quality, cheaper lunch.
Use the free observation deck at the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building instead of paid towers.
Book hotels that include breakfast to save approx. ₹2000 per day.
overall_vibe: Experience the ephemeral beauty of cherry blossoms from the comfort of boutique luxury. You will blend ancient Shinto traditions with modern high-end dining, moving seamlessly between neon skylines and tranquil Zen gardens.
packing_tips: Slip-on shoes are essential for frequent temple visits.
A portable Wi-Fi device or eSIM for seamless navigation.
Smart-casual attire for fine dining; some places require jackets for men.
smart_insights: Peak Sakura season (April) requires booking hotels 12 months in advance.
The JR Pass is no longer cost-effective for this route; buy individual Shinkansen Green Car tickets instead.
International flights from Mumbai (approx. ₹55k) are excluded from the daily breakdown to maintain luxury standards on-ground.

travel_between_cities.alternative: Flight from Haneda to Itami (₹8,000, 1hr) but train is more convenient.
travel_between_cities.booking: Purchase at any JR Ticket Office or via SmartEX app.
travel_between_cities.tips: Green Car offers larger seats, more legroom, and a quieter environment.

travel_between_cities.alternative: Limousine Bus (₹4,000, 7hrs) - Not recommended for luxury.
travel_between_cities.tips: Use the luggage storage area at the end of the car for large suitcases.

trip_title: Sakura & Serenity: A Curated Luxury Journey through Tokyo & Kyoto
validation_warnings: Some activities may have generic names (e.g.: Senso-ji Temple). For more specific recommendations, try providing more detailed preferences.
